name: Touhidur Rahman
title: Frontend Developer
career_summary: A self-learned software developer who dropped piloting career for the passion of coding. On the way to becoming a full-stack developer. Currently, a Frontend expert in Angular, although open for Reactjs. 3.5 years of professional experience and soft skills inherited from 8 years of military service contributing to a calm personality with leadership traits and capable of seeing the big picture. Loves learning new stuff.

tasks: Upgraded angular v5 to v8 within 2 weeks of joining.
Added charting library to display the complex data intuitively.
Added features that use lightweight Redux approach without any 3rd party library.
Deployed a self-coded chat microservice backend written in Nestjs and integrated it with the frontend.

As the main in-house developer, guiding the project towards technical excellence such as implementing autoformat with prettier, upgrading framework and libraries regularly, organize code architecture, follow best practices, etc.
Following a roadmap to becoming a Full-stack developer and get promoted in a leadership position in the company.
Joined as an intern and started with AngularJS (v1). I learned it within 1 month and started working on the core team. Got a full-time job offer right after 2 months of internship.
Conceptualized new UI/UX and added features to the apartment management system which handles 400k properties in 110 countries.
Upgraded Angular v1 to v5, used state management library NGRX.
Single-handedly upgraded official airline website built using basic PHP (no framework) to Codeigniter.
Upgraded UI from scratch. Developed a CMS for the site.
Made many decision-making tools e.g.- 'Route-wise Flight Cost Calculator' to determine optimum ticket price etc.
Maintained company social media profiles and ran ad campaigns.
Designed company overview magazine and marketing materials using Adobe Illustrator, InDesign & Photoshop.

other_experiences: Military Helicopter Pilot at Bangladesh Air Force (2007 - 2015).
Remote Web developer at Whyzlist.com, a Canadian startup (2016 - 2017).

education.university: Hochschule Fulda University of Applied Sciences
descriptions: Studied subjects like Middleware, Parallel Programming, Cloud Computing, Programming Paradigm, Test Oriented Software Development, User-Driven Development, Model-Driven Development, Web & Mobile Apps.
Tech-lead for final software project of a 6 members team, contributing ~50% code alone. Top grader in the team.
Master thesis on finding visual differences of web frontends using image processing.

achievements: DAAD Best international student award for excellent achievement by a foreign student, 2017.
